titles.title: Defending the Integrity of Voting Systems Act
Defending the Integrity of Voting Systems Act
Defending the Integrity of Voting Systems Act
Defending the Integrity of Voting Systems Act
Defending the Integrity of Voting Systems Act
Defending the Integrity of Voting Systems Act
Defending the Integrity of Voting Systems Act
Defending the Integrity of Voting Systems Act
Defending the Integrity of Voting Systems Act
A bill to amend title 18, United States Code, to prohibit interference with voting systems under the Computer Fraud and Abuse Act.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

calendar.text: Committee on the Judiciary. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on the Judiciary. Reported by Senator Graham without amendment. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 95.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime, Terrorism, and Homeland Security.
Ms. Jackson Lee moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 1321.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary:
Defending the Integrity of Voting Systems Act
This bill broadens the definition of protected computer, for purposes of computer fraud and abuse offenses, to include a computer that is part of a voting system.
